TextAsset.value: (So I agreed to meet with Mr. Driller on…)
The rooftop?
Why did you want to meet up here?
I guess I just wanted to go somewhere that was as far away from the ground as possible.
The ground…
It has too many bad memories.
Yeah…
I guess the roof would be the place to go, then.
I wish I could remember the good stuff about digging too…
But now when I look at dirt… all I can remember is how crazy I got.
I never thought digging could be so…
destructive.
I miss it, but… it’s better this way.
Yeah, but… you didn’t know the pipe was there.
If you’d known, I bet you would’ve stopped and gone around it.
If it hadn’t been there…
Your digging wouldn’t have hurt anything, and we wouldn’t be having this conversation.
But it was there, and what happened DID happen.
And a part of me was happy that Dad’s statue got destroyed, even if it was an accident…
I can’t deal with that!
There’s no point in wondering about it…
Just like Dad’s digging…
It really did break up our family.
Mom left because Dad wouldn’t stop digging long enough to pay her any attention.
There’s no use trying to cover that up.
That’s just what it is.
Wow… I’m so sorry…
I’ve got a big family, but…
If any of them left, I’d be devastated.
You know, after all the time we spent together, I never told you my real, main reason for digging.
I don’t even know why I kept it a secret...
I guess because it has to do with Dad, and…
I was feeling too bad about stuff to want to think about him.
I’m glad you can at least admit that, now…
(It’s a little less disturbing this way.)
It’s kind of silly, actually.
The main reason I like digging is just because I have such good memories of digging with my dad when I was a little kid.
He’d bury things like little toys and coins for me to find and dig up with my plastic shovel.
It was just so fun running around the yard like that…
I know it’s not anything big or inspirational, like a famous archaeology dig or anything…
But that’s really the reason why digging is so important to me.
I’ll remember it for the rest of my life, even if I never dig again.
I don’t think that’s silly at all.
That’s a great reason to love digging.
And if something makes you feel that way, you shouldn’t give it up.
Are you sure?
Maybe it’s better to give something up if it causes destruction.
That’s what I thought too…
About rolling my katamari.
I tried to pretend I didn’t have a passion for it, like you do for digging, but...
When I rolled that katamari for the first time, I loved it more than anything.
I thought it was better to put it away, since I caused so much trouble with it.
But now I think…
It’s better to keep trying, and I’ll do a better job next time with practice.
And maybe you can do that too…
Maybe you just need more practice.
But… what about my dad?
He’d be so disappointed if I picked up my drills again…
Even if it was just for practice.
Your dad is jerk! Who cares what he thinks!
H-how can you say that?
How can you sit there and tell me my dad is a jerk?
Come on!
He tries to stifle your passion, he tells you you’re wrong and bad…
I know you love him… But you kinda hate him a little bit too, right?
I just got done telling you about how the reason digging means so much to me…
Is because of how much I love my dad.
How can you be so insensitive?
C’mon, man.
Don’t bury it down like he does!
… You’re right…
I do kind of hate my dad.
I must, since I destroyed the statue of him…
I’m… I’m a terrible person!
No you aren’t!
You can love someone and hate stuff they do to you at the same time!
I hate to say it, but…
Your dad is not being a good father!
You don’t have to pretend he is just because he’s family.
So that’s it? What do I do now?
Disown my father?
No, man! I’m not saying you have to go that far!
Even fathers can make mistakes…
Maybe there’s still time to fix it.
I don’t know how to fix stuff.
I just know how to dig stuff up.
You’re his son!
He obviously cares about you…
He’s just doing a REALLY bad job of showing it.
And he’s probably afraid of losing you, like he lost your mom.
Afraid of losing ME?!
Of course! And… you love digging SO much.
You shouldn’t have to give that up for anything.
And it’s like you said… Digging is about discovery.
I know you can discover a way to keep digging, with passion AND moderation…
So you won’t destroy things anymore.
Maybe…
Maybe I could even help Dad discover that for himself as well…
If he’s anything like me…
I bet he misses digging too.
I bet he’ll even want to dig together with you again.
${slot:playerName}…
You’re gonna make me cry…
Be true to yourself!
Really, Pac-Man? You think I should?
A-alright! Yeah! I lost my way for a second there…
But I definitely will!
Thanks, Pac-Man! He really needed that.
${slot:playerName}, it’s not just me.
You’ve got to be true to yourself too!
You gotta get your katamari back from the confiscated weapons locker…
And you gotta roll it again someday.
Promise?
Y-yeah… I will…
Thanks, Mr. Driller…
I uh… I hope you know I really care about you.
Of course I know…
You didn’t keep that buried as well as you thought you did.
(He’s leaning in awfully close to me…
I think… we’re finally going to…
To…!)
Ahem!
Get a room, you two.
Eh heh heh… Uh….
I guess now’s not… the best time.. for, uh...
Um, I guess I’ll see you tomorrow, ${slot:playerName}!
(...Some discoveries…
We can leave for later.)
